info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Berks County through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sinking Spring, or near Reading, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Wernersville, Spring Ridge, Shillington, West Reading, Mount Penn, Mohnton, Kenhorst, St. Lawrence, Wyomissing Hills, West Lawn, Reiffton, Whitfield and West Wyomissing. This includes Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
